snippet.textDisplay:
Thank you so much! This was so much easier and comfortable than other patterns I found, and the video made it SO simple. The only thing I switched up was using ties instead of elastic loops, since elastic is hard to come by these days, and it isn't very comfortable to have ear loops when you wear glasses.


A ton of people asked me for the pattern, and I sent them here! Subscribed for all of the non-pandemic related projects as well :)
snippet.textOriginal:

A ton of people asked me for the pattern, and I sent them here! Subscribed for all of the non-pandemic related projects as well :)

snippet.textDisplay: I just made this mask and it looks fantastic! I don't have a sewing machine so I hand sewed it and still looks great, thank you so much for the pattern. PLEASE WASH THE MASK BEFORE RE-USING! The idea of it being reversible is so you have another style option, not that you can use it twice in a row. Stay safe, everyone. ♥️

snippet.textDisplay: I have made three of these now - super easy and the shape fits the face great! I found 6" of elastic was a little tight behind the ears, then went with 7" and settled on 6.5". If there are any gaps you can put in a quick dart - makes it not "reversible" but better fitting.I think for my next batch I will try to insert a thin piece of metal framing along the top seam so I can shape it to the nose- I think I can use an Acco prong paper fastener. Thanks for the awesome video!
snippet.textOriginal: I have made three of these now - super easy and the shape fits the face great! I found 6" of elastic was a little tight behind the ears, then went with 7" and settled on 6.5". If there are any gaps you can put in a quick dart - makes it not "reversible" but better fitting.I think for my next batch I will try to insert a thin piece of metal framing along the top seam so I can shape it to the nose- I think I can use an Acco prong paper fastener. Thanks for the awesome video!

snippet.textDisplay: This is an easy pattern to follow and I think I’ll make some of these for my family. However, I would add that it’s not safe to reverse the mask if you haven’t washed and dried the mask between wearing. When you wear a mask, all of the germs that the mask is keeping from your nose and mouth have landed on the outside of the mask. If you were to reverse the mask without a good cleaning and use your dryer on the hottest setting, you would be putting all of the germs right next to your face, nose and mouth. Thanks! Be safe!
snippet.textOriginal: This is an easy pattern to follow and I think I’ll make some of these for my family. However, I would add that it’s not safe to reverse the mask if you haven’t washed and dried the mask between wearing. When you wear a mask, all of the germs that the mask is keeping from your nose and mouth have landed on the outside of the mask. If you were to reverse the mask without a good cleaning and use your dryer on the hottest setting, you would be putting all of the germs right next to your face, nose and mouth. Thanks! Be safe!

snippet.textDisplay:
Read the Bible. Start in the Book of John then read Ephesians and Galatians. Then the Book of Revelation. We are in the end of times. Accept Jesus as your savior for ALL of your sins, past, present, and future. Jesus' blood paid for them all.
For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith—and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God— not by works, so that no one can boast. Ephesians 2:8-9.
If you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved. Romans 10:9
Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved. Acts 4:12
Receive Jesus as your Lord and savior while there is still time. Time is running out.

snippet.textDisplay: I made this. Good pattern. I added a 1/4th" and didn't sew along the line but sewed that 1/4 inch. (I'm a quilter  lol) Also the elastic is to big at 6" for a small face. Cut it to 5.5 or 5 for small faces.
snippet.textOriginal: I made this. Good pattern. I added a 1/4th" and didn't sew along the line but sewed that 1/4 inch. (I'm a quilter  lol) Also the elastic is to big at 6" for a small face. Cut it to 5.5 or 5 for small faces.

snippet.textDisplay:
I understand your good intentions, but people really shouldn't be reversing their face masks especially without ways to sterilize it from anything that might get on the outside. You do not want to touch the inside without cleaning your hands first and you don't want to be transferring abything from wearing it one way onto your face when you reverse it :/


I think the reversible face mask idea is cute , but maybe for a time other than a deadly pandemic.

snippet.textDisplay: Iron those 2 center seams OPEN before moving on to the next steps.  It'll greatly reduce the bulk , lay flatter and be more comfortable.  If you have troubles doing this, iron it over a pressing ham or something in the shape of a ball......like a sock stuffed full of other socks.
snippet.textOriginal: Iron those 2 center seams OPEN before moving on to the next steps.  It'll greatly reduce the bulk , lay flatter and be more comfortable.  If you have troubles doing this, iron it over a pressing ham or something in the shape of a ball......like a sock stuffed full of other socks.
